Package se.itu.hunt

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.itu.hunt.Board

  • public class Board
extends Object

    Represents a board for the game, with a treasure at a random Position.

    A board has a Dimension, e.g. (10 X 10) and typically has Position (0, 0) as its lower left corner. Other geometries will use a subclass of Position to handle coordinates differently.

      Constructs a new Board of a given Dimension.

      • Board

        public Board​(Dimension dimension)

        Constructs a new Board of a given Dimension. The Board will generate a random Position for the treasure.

        Parameters:
        dimension - This Board's Dimension

      • containsPosition

        public boolean containsPosition​(Position pos)
        Returns true if this Board contains the Position given as argument. A Board contains a Position if 0 <= Position.x and Position.x < width and 0 <= Position.y and Position.y < height.
        Parameters:
        pos - The Position to check if this Board contains
        Returns:
        true if this Board contains the Position, false otherwise.

      • treasurePosition

        public Position treasurePosition​()
        Returns this Board's treasure Position. Makes debugging (and cheating) easier.
        Returns:
        the Position of this Board's treasure

      • isTreasureAt

        public boolean isTreasureAt​(Position pos)
        Returns true if the treasure is at the given Position
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to check
        Returns:
        true if the treasure is at the given Position, false otherwise

      • toString

        public String toString​()
        Returns a java.lang.String representation of this Board on the form: Board of dimension (10 X 10) with treasure at (5, 5)
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A java.lang.String representation of this Board
